title: Kraft Heinz Releases 2023 Environmental Social Governance Report, Revealing Continued Progress Toward Goals ... - PR Newswire
summary: Kraft Heinz has released its 2023 ESG report, highlighting progress towards its sustainability goals. Key achievements include exceeding employee representation aspirations, providing meals to those in need, and reducing sugar in products. The company is also committed to environmental stewardship, showcasing advancements in renewable energy, sustainable packaging, and waste reduction.

title: Whole Foods Expands 'Sourced For Good' Label To Coffee - Store Brands Magazine
summary: Whole Foods Market is expanding its 'Sourced for Good' certification to its private label coffee, signifying responsible sourcing that benefits workers and the environment. The program raises millions annually for communities, providing benefits like housing, health services, and scholarships. title: 5 New technologies for beef producers - Successful Farming
summary: The beef industry is embracing new technologies to improve efficiency and build consumer trust. These innovations include virtual fences for cows, comprehensive cattle management software, third-party verification for food authenticity, water monitoring systems, and smart ear tags for bull health tracking. These technologies aim to optimize herd health, improve resource management, and provide transparency to consumers.

title: Oshi Salmon-Inspired Fillets Make Debut in NYC's Coletta Restaurant - vegconomist - the vegan business magazine
summary: Israeli startup Oshi, specializing in alternative seafood products, has launched its Salmon-Inspired Fillets at Coletta, a vegan Italian restaurant in New York City. The fillet, made from legume proteins and algae extracts, is designed to mimic the taste and texture of real salmon. Oshi's debut in the US market marks a significant milestone for the company, which aims to provide a sustainable alternative to traditional seafood.

title: MELITTA CANADA ANNOUNCES NEW SUSTAINABLE CERTIFICATIONS, HELPING CANADIAN COFFEE ... - Canada NewsWire
summary: Melitta Canada, a coffee company, announced several new sustainability initiatives. They launched a line of 100% Arabica Rainforest Alliance Certified whole bean coffees and obtained certifications for their cone filters from the Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) and the Biodegradable Products Institute (BPI). These certifications are meant to support sustainable farming practices, responsible forestry, and compostable products, allowing consumers to make more environmentally conscious choices.

title: New funds allow Merritt forestry company to get more value out of harvest - Merritt Herald
summary: The British Columbia government is funding a project by Stuwix Resources, a forestry management company owned by eight First Nations bands, to implement new processing approaches that will recover up to 35% more marketable volume from harvested trees. The project aims to create a new business line by allowing Stuwix to process more wood on-site, reducing wasted fibre and increasing the utilization of forest resources. This project is expected to increase wood product manufacturing and support First Nations economies in the province.

title: Nor-Feed makes progress in aquaculture - Aquafeed.com
summary: Nor-Feed, a French company specializing in plant-based additives for animal feed, has expanded its focus to aquaculture. Their products, like Nor-Grape and Nor-Spice AB, aim to replace xenobiotics in feed, improve growth and feed efficiency, and support the immune system of aquatic species. The company emphasizes using standardized and characterized products with known active ingredient concentrations.

title: Dundee to smelt up to 230000t of copper – Windhoek Observer - Windhoek Observer
summary: Dundee Precious Metals Tsumeb (DPMT) is a smelting company in Namibia that is facing financial difficulties due to the global market environment.  The company is implementing a cost optimization program to improve sustainability and is investing in a General Waste Management Facility to reduce environmental impact and create jobs. The new facility sorts waste for recycling and reduces the amount of waste sent to landfills, contributing to a more sustainable approach to waste management.
